1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
bitterness, i.e. (figuratively) rebellion; concretely, bitter, or rebellious
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

3.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
something arranged or fixed, i.e. a place

4.brief: to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)

5.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

6.brief: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

7.brief: there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)

8.brief: the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

9.brief: properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

10.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

11.brief: to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application

12.brief: a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to withdraw (both literally and figuratively, whether intransitive or transitive)
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

13.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
themselves (often used emphatic for the copula, also in indirect relation)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

15.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

16.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to soften (intransitively or transitively), used figuratively
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously

17.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)
